replies.body: ARAM has its own MMR rating. It's not a game mode that should be taken seriously, do not take it seriously.

I would like to point out, the entire basis of ARAM is that it's random. It's not uncommon for skill to be irrelevant. Not to mention, it's an entirely different map than SR, it only has 1 lane and no jungle. When it comes right down to it there are plenty of people in high elo that only know how to play 1-10 champions, and only on SR. It's also entirely possible they've been boosted. Given that, it is accurate that, in a situation where they have a champion randomly picked for them from a pool of potentially 100+, they will end up with a much lower MMR, one that more accurately represents their skill with **all** the champions they own rather than just a select few.

If you were expecting people to do just as well in ARAM as they do in SR, you're either naive or a complete idiot.
a level 19 might just of been playing with a high rated MMR Summoner which happened to be on the same team as you.
